title: How did the communist regime in Cuba survive the fall of the Soviet Union while all other Soviet-aligned states underwent economic and political reform? - Quora

response.answer_text: Communism is a stateless society, any state calling itself communist is an oxymoron. The Russian State Capitalist regime had an empire of colonial possessions and not aligned states. The 1959 revolution in Cuba was not communist, it did not involve the working class, Castro hated communism. Cuba only declared itself ‘communist’ in 1961 to get Russian support. After 1989 the Cuban ruling class sought to gain support from China… the copy cat of the Russian model.
